intro: Hieracium duriacense, commonly known as the hardy hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow daisy-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are typically lance-shaped with serrated edges. Native to regions of Europe and parts of Asia, it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its hardy nature, it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides.
